item.title: Gimlet
item.dc:creator: lutiendat
item.description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elitsi edo eiusmod senteas tempor incididunt ut labore et dolr emagna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim dano ris veniam quis
item.content:encoded:
Another story has also been recorded, that the name Gimlet comes from a doctor named Thomas Gimlette. It is said that he was the one who mixed Rose’s Lime Cordial with Gin and gave them to his fellow sailors to drink, from which he took his name to give this drink. Gradually, the public accepted Vodka more than Gin, and it was used to replace Gin in Gimlet dishes in many places, but Bartenders were still more passionate about Gin.

Weight 0.5 kg
Dimensions 36 × 28 × 10 cm

item.title: Sidecar cocktail
item.dc:creator: lutiendat
item.description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elitsi edo eiusmod senteas tempor incididunt ut labore et dolr emagna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim dano ris veniam quis
item.content:encoded:
The first recipe for Sidecar appeared in 1922 and the Ritz Hotel in Paris claimed to be the origin of this cocktail.

Sidecar is the direct generation of Brandy Crusta, a long-forgotten New Orleans drink.

How it got its name is a source of debate: Both French and British bars claim to have concocted a combination of cognac, Cointreau, and lemonade for one customer.

However, former bar staff Dale DeGroff said the name of the drink is related to the mixture left in the shaker after shaking.

 

Weight 0.5 kg
Dimensions 36 × 28 × 10 cm

item.title: Mint Julep
item.dc:creator: lutiendat
item.description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elitsi edo eiusmod senteas tempor incididunt ut labore et dolr emagna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim dano ris veniam quis
item.content:encoded:
In the old days people did not use Bourbon but used Rye Whiskey or Brandy as a base wine.

It was not until Mint Julep was brought to Washington D.C by the Americans that they used Bourbon to make this cocktail. Actually, you can make Mint Julep with Cognac, Rye Whiskey or even Rum or Gin. Mint Julep is also one of a number of Cocktails that has its own glass: a glass made of tin, used only to serve this particular drink. You can also use a Rock glass, that’s okay.

Recipe for making Mint Julep (The base wine is Bourbon, if you want to replace it with Cognac or Rye Whisky or whatever, feel free to experiment).

 

Weight 0.5 kg
Dimensions 36 × 28 × 10 cm

item.title: Whiskey Sour
item.dc:creator: lutiendat
item.description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elitsi edo eiusmod senteas tempor incididunt ut labore et dolr emagna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim dano ris veniam quis
item.content:encoded:
Whiskey Sour is a cocktail with high alcohol content, so it is often loved by men. This drink is also enjoyed after dinner parties to help better digestion. With Whiskey Sour, passionate Whiskey is softened by a light lemon taste and a little sweetness, shaking with ice will help the enjoyer have a very pleasant feeling, dispel the fatigue in daily work. Are you thirsty yet? Let’s join Beptruong.edu.vn to the counter to prepare a glass of Whiskey Sour to enjoy!

 

Weight 0.5 kg
Dimensions 36 × 28 × 10 cm

item.title: Mojito
item.dc:creator: lutiendat
item.description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elitsi edo eiusmod senteas tempor incididunt ut labore et dolr emagna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim dano ris veniam quis
item.content:encoded:
What is Mojito?
Mojito is the name of a very famous cocktail in the world. Mojito is made from soda, with the coolness of mint, the sour taste of lemon combined with the passionate taste of rum. The transparent drink, highlighted with the green color of mint leaves and lemon, is a familiar image of Mojito glasses. Mojito is suitable to enjoy on hot days, the sour, sweet, and spicy taste of the drink helps you to quench your thirst and relax effectively.

Weight 0.5 kg
Dimensions 36 × 28 × 10 cm

item.title: Cocktail-Moscow
item.dc:creator: lutiendat
item.description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elitsi edo eiusmod senteas tempor incididunt ut labore et dolr emagna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim dano ris veniam quis
item.content:encoded:
The Moscow Mule is a Russian cocktail made with vodka, spicy ginger ale and lime juice, garnished with a slice or wedge of lemon. It is commonly served in a copper cup, which has the cold temperature of the liquid. However, today the Moscow Mule cocktail is created by many different versions based on the classic recipe. So, Delicious Fruit will teach you how to make a delicious tangerine Moscow Mule cocktail.

Weight 0.5 kg
Dimensions 36 × 28 × 10 cm

item.title: Vodka
item.dc:creator: lutiendat
item.description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elitsi edo eiusmod senteas tempor incididunt ut labore et dolr emagna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim dano ris veniam quis
item.content:encoded:
Vodka (Polish: wódka [Vutka], Russian: водка [Votkə]) is a distilled alcoholic beverage originating in Poland and Russia, consisting primarily of water and ethanol but sometimes with traces of impurities and aromas. Traditionally, alcohol was made by distilling liquid from fermented grains or potatoes, although some modern brands use fruit or sugar for fermentation.

Since the 1890s, the standard vodka has been 40% alcohol by volume (ABV) (80 US proof).[1][2] The European Union has established a minimum alcohol content of 37.5% for vodka.[3][4] Vodka in the United States must have a minimum alcohol content of 40%.[5]

Vodka is traditionally drunk “neat” or “straight” (not mixed with water, ice or other cocktails), although it is often served chilled in the freezer in vodka belt countries such as Belarus, Estonia, Finland, Iceland, Lithuania, Latvia, Norway, Poland, Russia, Sweden and Ukraine. It is also used in cocktails and mixed drinks, such as Vodka Martini, Cosmopolitan, Vodka Tonic, Screwdriver, Greyhound, Black Russian or White Russian, Moscow Mule, Bloody Mary and Bloody Caesar.

Weight 0.5 kg
Dimensions 36 × 28 × 10 cm
